content.meaning: a method of packing data in order to save disk storage space or download time
content.example: ZIP is an example of a common file compression algorithm.

content.meaning: a software component that lets the operating system and a device communicate with each other
content.example: The IT support technician asked the end user if he had recently updated any device drivers.

content.meaning: a set of strict rules for controlling read, write and execute access to a file or directory
content.example: The company switched from FAT32 to the NTFS file system because the former did not support file permissions.

content.meaning: prepare a device to store data, erasing any existing data
content.example: One must format a flash memory drive or a hard disk drive before it can be used to store data.

content.meaning: the fundamental part of an operating system is responsible for resource management and file access
content.example: The system administrator needed to upgrade the kernel in order to provide native support for Serial ATA drives.

content.meaning: a GUI or CLI software link between the computer and the operator
content.example: The programmer tested his code on many operating systems including Windows, macOS, and Linux.

content.meaning: a computer resource that uses software instead of a physical computer to run programs and deploy apps
content.example: In order to run Java programs in Windows, one needs to download an appropriate virtual machine.
